19#include <memory>
20
21namespace ZXing {
22
23class ByteArray;
24
25/**
26* The purpose of this class hierarchy is to abstract different bitmap implementations across
27* platforms into a standard interface for requesting greyscale luminance values. The interface
28* only provides immutable methods; therefore crop and rotation create copies. This is to ensure
29* that one Reader does not modify the original luminance source and leave it in an unknown state
30* for other Readers in the chain.
31*
32* @author dswitkin@google.com (Daniel Switkin)
33*/
34class LuminanceSource
35{
36public:
37 virtual ~LuminanceSource() = default;
38
39 /**
40 * @return The width of the bitmap.
41 */
42 virtual int width() const = 0;
43
44 /**
45 * @return The height of the bitmap.
46 */
47 virtual int height() const = 0;
48
49 /**
50 * Fetches one row of luminance data from the underlying platform's bitmap. Values range from
51 * 0 (black) to 255 (white). Because Java does not have an unsigned byte type, callers will have
52 * to bitwise and with 0xff for each value. It is preferable for implementations of this method
53 * to only fetch this row rather than the whole image, since no 2D Readers may be installed and
54 * getMatrix() may never be called.
55 *
56 * @param y The row to fetch, which must be in [0,getHeight())
57 * @param row An optional preallocated array. If null or too small, it will be ignored.
58 * Always use the returned object, and ignore the .length of the array.
59 * @return An array containing the luminance data.
60 */
61 virtual const uint8_t* getRow(int y, ByteArray& buffer, bool forceCopy = false) const = 0;
62
63 /**
64 * Fetches luminance data for the underlying bitmap. Values should be fetched using:
65 * {@code int luminance = array[y * width + x] & 0xff}
66 *
67 * @return A row-major 2D array of luminance values. Do not use result.length as it may be
68 * larger than width * height bytes on some platforms. Do not modify the contents
69 * of the result.
70 */
71 virtual const uint8_t* getMatrix(ByteArray& buffer, int& outRowBytes, bool forceCopy = false) const = 0;
72
73 /**
74 * @return Whether this subclass supports cropping.
75 */
76 virtual bool canCrop() const;
77
78 /**
79 * Returns a new object with cropped image data. Implementations may keep a reference to the
80 * original data rather than a copy. Only callable if isCropSupported() is true.
81 *
82 * @param left The left coordinate, which must be in [0,getWidth())
83 * @param top The top coordinate, which must be in [0,getHeight())
84 * @param width The width of the rectangle to crop.
85 * @param height The height of the rectangle to crop.
86 * @return A cropped version of this object.
87 */
88 virtual std::shared_ptr<LuminanceSource> cropped(int left, int top, int width, int height) const;
89
90 /**
91 * @return Whether this subclass supports counter-clockwise rotation.
92 */
93 virtual bool canRotate() const;
94
95 /**
96 * Returns a new object with rotated image data by 90 degrees counterclockwise.
97 * Only callable if {@link #isRotateSupported()} is true.
98 *
99 * @return A rotated version of this object.
100 */
101 virtual std::shared_ptr<LuminanceSource> rotated(int degreeCW) const;
102
103 /**
104 * @return a wrapper of this {@code LuminanceSource} which inverts the luminances it returns -- black becomes
105 * white and vice versa, and each value becomes (255-value).
106 */
107 static std::shared_ptr<LuminanceSource> CreateInverted(const std::shared_ptr<LuminanceSource>& src);
108
109protected:
110 virtual std::shared_ptr<LuminanceSource> getInverted() const;
111
112};
113
114} // ZXing
115
